block.comment: changes position according to the dice.

block.l: Choose which property you want to mortgage? Enter property's position.
Choose which property you want to mortgage? Enter property's position.

block.comment: Item 1-7 of each of the sublist in this list represent: name of property, cost to buy, color (for house upgrades), rent, number of houses, owner of property and mortgaged or not
The variables "position", "moola(money)" and "player property" represent separately the position, amount of money and properties of player 1 to 3, in that order.

block.l: How many AIs do you want? Select a number from 0 to 2. (If for some reason you want all AIs, select 3)
Player 1/AI's turn! Press Space to start.
Click me to check property's ownership. Click each player to check money/property status.

block.comment: These four variables exist for the sole purpose of making my code easier to read, as you will be able to see later.
If the player is in jail, there is a chance that he will stay in/bail out. Otherwise, the player rolls the dice as normal.

custom-block.s: Paid fine and out of UCPD

block.l: Still not time for you to get out!

block.comment: This is the $200 salary if you pass by the start (i.e. go back from a big position number to a small position number)

block.l: You have received $200 for no reason at all!
Actually it is because the rule book said so.

block.comment: AI will buy if it has ample money after the buy and if the property has really good rent.

list.l: decides not to buy this property because he doesn't have much money.

block.l: Do you want to buy the property? 1. Yes. Anything else. No.
You do not have enough money to buy this property!

custom-block.s: does player %s own all the properties of same color %s ?
custom-block.comment: if the player/AI owns all colors of a property, the player/AI can choose how many houses to buy, the total number not exceeding 5.

list.l: is the optimal amount for AI

block.l: You have exceeded the limit of houses you can build. Please enter another number.

custom-block.s: pay or earn money according to %s

block.comment: Arguably the most important algorithm. Computes your earning/spending according to the attributes of the properties you step on BEFORE mortgages and buy backs.

custom-block.s: pay or earn money according to %s

list.l: to him/her. Better luck next time.

custom-block.s: pay or earn money according to %s

block.comment: adds to the list that represents the properties specific player owns(in this case the current player's property list). The list will come in handy when mortgage/upgrade happens.

custom-block.s: does player %s own all the properties of same color %s ?

block.comment: asking or forcing (only if money fall below 0) the player/AI for mortgage. The AI will perform a smart mortgage function.

block.l: You are out of money, which means you are about to be bankrupt if you do not mortgage your properties!

block.comment: If after mortgaging all of the properties the player/AI still has no money (<0), the player/AI bankrupts and the game is over for him/her.

custom-block.s: AI chooses to mortgage or not

block.l: Do you want to mortgage your properties? 1. Yes. Anything else. No.
Do you want to mortgage your properties? 1. Yes. Anything else. No

custom-block.comment: Asking the player if he/she wants to buy back mortgaged properties.
If only one player/AI, remains, the game ends and he/she is the winner.

block.l: Which property do you want to see? Enter an integer less than 41.

custom-block.comment: This block is supposed to be under the buy back section, but I did not manage to make this block due to unforseen difficulties implementing.

block-definition.s: pay or earn money according to %'square landed'
does player %'player' own all the properties of same color %'color' ?

block.l: You have reached the starting point.
A protest is happening in Cal! The chancellor charges everyone $100 to pay for police and helicopter!

list.l: Let's see what is on there.

block.l: You got luck this time! But beware!
Oops, you have been caught smoking shady substances. UCPD has detained you!
Frat party, baby! Drunk party, baby! UCPD, baby!
Rally committee calls you to rally for the Big Game (that we are going to lose anyways). The school spirit makes you spend $100 on the ticket.
Free pizza on memorial glade! Saves you $100 food money (Not applicable to real life).
Sssssome Hassssss sssstudent with a sssstartup. Lossssse $150 for hisssss idea of a "jetpack uber".
In fact, you skillfully avoided the flyer. Other players are so impressed that they gave you $75 each.
Some controversial speaker visiting campus! Lost $50 in the chaos.
Wait, Cal football team actually won?! You feel like you have just won $100.
An article about grade deflation. Spends $100 on boba due to depression.
UCPD putting more forces on striking other crimes? They put less attention on you and your drug habits! Get away from UCPD for free once.

block-definition.s: amount of properties owned by players other than %'player'

block.l: How many houses do you want to buy? Pick a number between 0 to 4.

block-definition.comment: LABEL will stamp text on the stage at the given font size. The direction of the text is the direction the sprite is facing, and color will match the pen color.

block.l: var stage = this.parentThatIsA(StageMorph), context = stage.penTrails().getContext('2d'), rotation = radians(this.direction() - 90), trans = new Point( this.center().x - stage.left(), this.center().y - stage.top() ), isWarped = this.Warped, len, pos; if (isWarped) {endWarp(); } context.save(); context.font = size + 'px monospace'; context.textAlign = 'left'; context.textBaseline = 'alphabetic'; context.fillStyle = this.color.toString(); len = context.measureText(text).width; trans = trans.multiplyBy(1 / stage.scale); context.translate(trans.x, trans.y); context.rotate(rotation); context.fillText(text, 0, 0); context.translate(-trans.x, -trans.y); context.restore(); pos = new Point( len * Math.sin(radians(this.direction())), len * Math.cos(radians(this.direction()))); pos = pos.add(new Point(this.xPosition(), this.yPosition())); this.gotoXY(pos.x, pos.y, false); this.changed(); if (isWarped) {this.startWarp(); } stage.changed();
